tool.name: OpenSwathDecoyGenerator
tool.description: Generates decoys according to different models for a specific TraML
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && echo ARGS && cat '$args_json' && echo HARD && cat '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file

param.name: out_type
param.label: Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content

param.name: method
param.label: decoy generation method ('shuffle','pseudo-reverse','reverse','shift')

param.name: decoy_tag
param.label: decoy tag

param.name: switchKR
param.label: Whether to switch terminal K and R (to achieve different precursor mass)

param.name: min_decoy_fraction
param.label: Minimum fraction of decoy / target peptides and proteins

param.name: aim_decoy_fraction
param.label: Number of decoys the algorithm should generate (if unequal to 1, the algorithm will randomly select N peptides for decoy generation)

param.name: shuffle_max_attempts
param.label: shuffle: maximum attempts to lower the amino acid sequence identity between target and decoy for the shuffle algorithm

param.name: shuffle_sequence_identity_threshold
param.label: shuffle: target-decoy amino acid sequence identity threshold for the shuffle algorithm

param.name: shift_precursor_mz_shift
param.label: shift: precursor ion MZ shift in Thomson for shift decoy method

param.name: shift_product_mz_shift
param.label: shift: fragment ion MZ shift in Thomson for shift decoy method

param.name: product_mz_threshold
param.label: MZ threshold in Thomson for fragment ion annotation

param.name: allowed_fragment_types
param.label: allowed fragment types

param.name: allowed_fragment_charges
param.label: allowed fragment charge states

param.name: enable_detection_specific_losses
param.label: set this flag if specific neutral losses for detection fragment ions should be allowed

param.name: enable_detection_unspecific_losses
param.label: set this flag if unspecific neutral losses (H2O1, H3N1, C1H2N2, C1H2N1O1) for detection fragment ions should be allowed

param.name: separate
param.label: set this flag if decoys should not be appended to targets

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Generates decoys according to different models for a specific TraML
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_OpenSwathDecoyGenerator.html
